answerText: Sachs-Wolfe effect[10] The Sachs-Wolfe effect relates temperature anisotropy in this thing, which was studied by the COBE experiment, to density fluctuations.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 15 | 1 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This effect is a third smaller than expected due to the universe expanding as the two-thirds power of time at the time of recombination, cancelling two-thirds of the observed redshift. For 10 points each: [10] Name this effect which relates temperature fluctuations to gravitational potentials.
